intro: Sisymbrium edwardsii, commonly known as the Edwards' babylon wheat, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, and its seeds are enclosed in pods. Sisymbrium edwardsii is often found in disturbed soils and can be an indicator of arid environments.
